modules.description: Provides functions to create and update a damped spring simulation, using a time step, angular frequency, and damping ratio. Operates on a `t` type representing the spring state and a `snapshot` type tracking position and velocity. Used to smoothly animate values toward a target position, such as in UI transitions or physics-based movement.

Calculates and updates spring-based animations using a set of parameters including target, stiffness, and damping. It operates on numeric values and vectors, supporting both 2D and 3D positions. It is used to create realistic movement in UI elements, character physics, and object transitions.

Encapsulates a damped spring simulation with functions to initialize and evolve the system over time, using a `t` type to track internal state and a `snapshot` type to capture position and velocity. Supports adjusting parameters like angular frequency and damping ratio to control the behavior of the simulation. Can be used to animate values toward a target, such as smoothly moving a UI element to a new position. Operations include updating the state based on a time step and retrieving current position and velocity from a snapshot.
